intro: Minuria cunninghamii, commonly known as the white-flowered minuria, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a glossy green surface. It typically grows in open woodlands and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
